comment.author: 13935339@N05
comment._content: F2A-3 - lengthened firewall. CDR J.C. Clifton in flight near Miami Municipal Airport (background, left), looking south-southeast; Master Field, adjacent to Municipal, is blocked from view by Clifton's right wing. During the war, the three fields in the NAS Miami complex were known simply as "Mainside" (Opa Locka), "Master" and "Municipal."

comment.author: 107668776@N06
comment._content: Hi, I was wondering if you,by chance have any good pics of the f2a-3 interior?just got kami de koro koros 1/144th 2a3.im gonna dremel the cockpit area out to try and put in cockpit detail.I just dont have much on the way of pics for it.The only thing i do have is the in action series book.Not much in the way of good cockpit pics.

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/107668776@N06] It doesn't look like we do.  All of our F2A images have been digitized and are on this fickr site, and I didn't see any cockpit shots :(
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

comment.author: 13935339@N05
comment._content: For 1/144 scale, the differences between an F2A-3 cockpit and earlier variants would be indistinguishable - other than the fact that -3 "guts" were Interior Green vs. earlier model inards being Silver lacquer.
